question: What policy mechanisms and national actions are supporting the development of the sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) industry globally and in Australia?
ground_truth_answer: Globally, SAF development is supported through blending mandates, subsidies, and revenue support mechanisms in regions such as the EU, US, UK, and Asia. In Australia, Qantas is advocating for a domestic SAF industry with a policy framework combining 'demand side' mandates and 'supply side' financial incentives.
contexts: The EU has enacted progressive blending mandates including sub-mandates for e-fuels.
The US has financial incentives and support mechanisms for producers.
The UK plans to legislate for producer revenue support mechanisms in 2025.
Asia and Japan are introducing SAF blending mandates, and Singapore proposes a levy on all departing flights.
Qantas is advocating for a domestic SAF sector in Australia and supports a policy mix of mandates and financial incentives.

question: What are the key policy and strategic measures KLM is implementing to support the use of Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) by 2025 and beyond?
ground_truth_answer: KLM is complying with an EU mandate to blend 2% SAF by the end of 2024, ahead of its mandatory start in 2025. It offers voluntary SAF contribution options to customers, launched SAF initiatives via Transavia, and participates in Project SkyPower to scale e-SAF production. The SAF surcharge will also become mandatory in 2025.
contexts: By the end of 2024, KLM blended a rounded 2 per cent SAF, in accordance with the EU mandate that applies from 2025.
KLM offers customers the option to voluntarily contribute to extra SAF usage.
Transavia launched a SAF initiative enabling passengers to opt for a SAF contribution.
Air France–KLM is initiator and KLM is co-chair of Project SkyPower, aiming to scale up e-SAF production from renewable sources.
The SAF surcharge will become mandatory starting in 2025.

question: What operational policies and efficiency initiatives has Lufthansa implemented to reduce fuel consumption and CO₂ emissions as of 2023–2024?
ground_truth_answer: Lufthansa implemented several efficiency measures, including switching off engines during taxi-in, which saves up to 2,750 tonnes of kerosene annually. They also reduced aircraft weight by repainting planes to remove old paint layers (saving 4.1 tonnes across 30 aircraft) and optimized freshwater loading on Boeing aircraft, saving 700 tonnes of kerosene per year. These initiatives support Lufthansa’s broader OPS Sustainability Programme targeting CO₂ reduction by 2030.
contexts: Lufthansa saves up to 2,750 tonnes of kerosene per year by shutting down one or more engines while taxiing.
Aircraft repainting saved 4.1 tonnes of weight across 30 planes in 2023.
Optimisation of freshwater volumes on B747 and B787 fleets saved around 700 tonnes of kerosene annually.
All Lufthansa flight operations participate in the OPS Sustainability Programme targeting CO₂ reductions by 2030.
